name: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Coconut Milk
author: Mrs.Stvnsn
summary: A creamy butternut squash soup with the warm flavors of curry and ginger, and creaminess from coconut milk. A great way to warm up in the fall and winter months!
ingredients: 1 (3 1/2) pound butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded
1 medium leek, white portion only, chopped
1 teaspoon curry powder, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil
Wrap each garlic half in foil and place on the prepared baking sheet
Roast in the preheated oven until vegetables are golden and squash skin is easily pierced with a fork, 45 minutes to 1 hour
Squeeze out roasted garlic cloves and scoop out squash flesh into a food processor or blender with onion, leek, and ginger
Add 2 cups broth and puree (in batches if necessary) until smooth
Place the pot over medium heat and add remaining broth
Whisk in coconut milk, curry powder, and cayenne pepper
Season with salt and black pepper, and cook until heated through, about 15 minutes
